title: Electron moves in same direction as magnetic field

content.description: A uniform magnetic field B directed downward parallel to the plane of the page exists in the shaded region shown above. An electron can enter the field from different directions.
content.question: Suppose that the electron is moving straight down in the same direction as B when it enters the region of the magnetic field. What is the direction of the magnetic force, if any, on the electron when it first enters the field region?

choices.label: Toward the bottom of the page
Toward the top of the page
None; there is no magnetic force on the electron.

content.answer: None; there is no magnetic force on the electron.
